perturbation.original_text:
Definitions

1.1 In this Agreement, including the recitals, except as expressly provided or unless  the context otherwise requires,

(a) Affiliate means, in respect of a party hereto, a corporation which is the subsidiary  of the party or vice versa or where each of the party and the corporation is controlled by  the same person,
perturbation.changed_text:
Definitions

1.1 In this Agreement, including the recitals, except as expressly provided or unless  the context otherwise requires,

(a) Affiliate means, in respect of a party hereto, any entity with a business relationship to the party, regardless of ownership structure.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Affiliate' is based on corporate control (subsidiary, parent, or common control). The modified definition broadens this to any entity with a 'business relationship', contradicting the specific control-based definition and creating ambiguity. This impacts sections relying on the original definition for rights and obligations, especially clause 1.3

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Time is of the essence in the performance of all obligations under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1 Time is of the essence in the performance of all obligations under this Agreement.

However, deadlines may be extended at the discretion of Glamis Gold Ltd.
perturbation.explanation: Section 4.1 states 'Time is of the essence,' a standard legal clause emphasizing strict adherence to deadlines. Adding a clause that deadlines may be extended introduces a contradiction. This creates uncertainty, especially in clauses like 2.2 (Right of First Offer) where strict timelines are defined.

perturbation.original_text: 4.7 This Agreement will enure to the benefit of and be binding upon the respective  heirs, executors, administrators, personal representatives, successors and permitted assigns of  each party hereto.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.7 This Agreement will enure to the benefit of and be binding upon the respective  heirs, executors, administrators, personal representatives, successors and permitted assigns of  each party hereto.

However, Western Copper cannot assign this agreement to any other parties without prior written approval from Glamis Gold LTD.
perturbation.explanation: Clause 4.7 states the agreement is binding on successors and permitted assigns of each party. Adding a restriction that Western Copper cannot assign without approval creates a contradiction. While it doesn't explicitly prohibit assignment, it introduces a requirement for Glamis's approval, conflicting with the original clause implying free assignability (subject to typical legal constraints).
